{"bio":"Elizabeth is an Immigration Solicitor with over five years' experience in UK immigration, asylum and human rights law. She advises individual and family clients on a wide range of applications, including spouse and partner visas, private and family life routes, long residence and settlement, naturalisation and registration as a British citizen, and EU Settlement Scheme matters.

She also advises on Points Based System and work-related applications, such as Skilled Worker and other sponsored work routes, and is now developing an enhanced focus on business immigration at Osbourne Pinner, with particular emphasis on sponsor licence strategy and compliance, Skilled Worker planning for employers, and Global Talent and other advanced business routes for highly skilled individuals.

Before joining Osbourne Pinner, Elizabeth built a strong background in complex and refused cases and has prepared and managed numerous appeals before the First-tier Tribunal and the Upper Tribunal (Immigration and Asylum Chamber). She regularly deals with appeals, human rights applications and protection claims, preparing detailed evidence and submissions and working closely with counsel on case strategy and advocacy. With this background in complex appeals and human rights, she brings a careful, strategic approach to all of her work and is well placed to advise where business, protection and long-residence issues overlap.

Elizabeth is used to running a demanding caseload from start to finish. She is comfortable taking over matters part-way through, untangling complex histories, identifying gaps in evidence or reasoning and putting cases back on a firm footing. Clients value her meticulous preparation, clear explanations and calm, empathetic manner, especially in stressful and time-sensitive situations. She is bilingual in English and Turkish and regularly assists Turkish-speaking and other international clients in the UK and overseas.","image":"https://osbournepinner.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/03/Elizabeth-Kumcu.jpg","skills":["Spouse/partner visas","Private & family life","Long residence","Naturalisation","EU Settlement Scheme","Skilled Worker","Sponsor licence strategy & compliance","Global Talent","Appeals (First-tier & Upper Tribunal)","Human rights & protection claims","Turkish speaker"],"education":"","job_title":"Immigration Solicitor","pseudonym":null,"department":"Immigration","github_url":null,"description":"Elizabeth is an Immigration Solicitor with over five years' experience in UK immigration, asylum and human rights law, specialising in complex appeals and business immigration.","is_featured":true,"twitter_url":null,"achievements":[],"linkedin_url":"https://osbournepinner.com/team-profile-elizabeth-kumcu/","display_order":13,"portfolio_url":null,"certifications":[],"is_team_member":true,"experience_years":5,"assigned_sections":[],"years_of_experience":5}

{"bio":"Ibrar is a tenacious Solicitor with over 18 years of legal experience in high-value and complex matters. The experience gained over the years has enabled him to deal with all aspects of residential and commercial conveyancing, including freehold and leasehold sales and purchases, re-mortgages, transfers of equity, and new-build properties. Ibrar also has considerable expertise in dealing with Islamic finance transactions and Sharia-compliant mortgages.","image":null,"skills":["Residential & commercial conveyancing","Freehold/leasehold sales & purchases","Re-mortgages","Transfers of equity","New-build properties","Islamic finance & Sharia-compliant mortgages"],"education":"","job_title":"Property Solicitor","pseudonym":null,"department":"Property / Conveyancing","github_url":null,"description":"Ibrar is a tenacious Solicitor with over 18 years of experience in residential and commercial conveyancing, including Islamic finance and Sharia-compliant mortgages.","is_featured":true,"twitter_url":null,"achievements":[],"linkedin_url":"https://osbournepinner.com/?page_id=36556&preview=true","display_order":17,"portfolio_url":null,"certifications":[],"is_team_member":true,"experience_years":18,"assigned_sections":[],"years_of_experience":18}

{"bio":"Sana is very passionate about her clients. She specialises in small, medium and large companies for their sponsor licence application with a high success rate. Sana also has a high success rate in litigation.

A forward thinker, Sana has considerable experience in the legal sector possessing in excess of 10 years specialising in dealing with clients for a wide range of cases including sponsor Licences, Compliances Visits, Skilled Worker Visa and Global Talent Visa.

She is dedicated to realising the potential of information in the Legal sector to enhance the effectiveness, efficiency and intermodality of current law from the local to the global level.

Sana also runs her own small caseload to assist our Civil Litigation Clients in all aspects of their work and particularly involving preparation of tenancy agreements, defending against eviction, removing troublesome tenants, serving notices, etc.

She also specialises, with a high success rate, in immigration matters, especially in Global Talent Visa, Sponsorship License and the full PBS system.","image":"https://osbournepinner.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/06/Sana-Pervaiz.jpg","skills":["Sponsor licence applications","Compliance visits","Skilled Worker & Global Talent visas","Civil litigation","Tenancy agreements","Eviction defence","Landlord & tenant disputes"],"education":"","job_title":"Senior Litigation Caseworker","pseudonym":null,"department":"Litigation & Immigration","github_url":null,"description":"Sana is passionate about her clients with over 10 years of experience specialising in sponsor licences, compliance visits, Skilled Worker & Global Talent visas, and civil litigation.","is_featured":true,"twitter_url":null,"achievements":[],"linkedin_url":"https://osbournepinner.com/team-profile-sana-pervaiz/","display_order":18,"portfolio_url":null,"certifications":[],"is_team_member":true,"experience_years":10,"assigned_sections":[],"years_of_experience":10}

{"bio":"A results-driven and commercially minded solicitor with extensive experience in commercial litigation, contractual disputes, and corporate advisory matters. Skilled in handling complex contentious issues from pre-action through to trial, including drafting pleadings, managing County Court proceedings, and liaising with counsel to achieve favourable outcomes for clients.

He is able to demonstrate strong expertise in drafting and negotiating commercial contracts, shareholder agreements, and settlement documentation, ensuring compliance and protecting business interests. Provides pragmatic, business-focused legal advice on corporate governance, director duties, shareholder disputes, and risk management. Experienced in managing litigation strategy, assessing case merits, and advising clients on cost-effective dispute resolution pathways.

Proficient in conducting County Court and civil litigation involving contractual breaches, debt recovery, and enforcement actions. Adept at preparing and reviewing witness statements, drafting letters before claim, and setting aside default judgments. Combines meticulous attention to detail with sound commercial judgment to deliver robust representation and client-centric service.

Additionally experienced in conveyancing matters, offering a well-rounded understanding of both contentious and non-contentious legal work. Skilled in handling GDPR compliance, subject access requests, and cease-and-desist notices, ensuring adherence to regulatory and procedural standards.

With a meticulous and commercially astute approach, Mohammed is adept at navigating complex legal frameworks while providing clear, strategic, and results-driven advice. He combines technical proficiency with a pragmatic mindset, ensuring that clients receive tailored, cost-effective solutions aligned with their objectives. His ability to think ahead, anticipate risks, and craft innovative legal strategies sets him apart in high-stakes disputes. Whether representing individuals, landlords, businesses, or property investors, Mohammed is committed to delivering robust, practical solutions through negotiation, alternative dispute resolution, or litigation.","image":null,"skills":["Commercial litigation","Contractual disputes","Corporate advisory","Drafting/negotiating contracts & shareholder agreements","Corporate governance","Director duties","Shareholder disputes","Risk management","County Court/civil litigation","Debt recovery","Enforcement actions","GDPR compliance","Conveyancing","Alternative dispute resolution"],"education":"","job_title":"Senior Solicitor","pseudonym":null,"department":"Commercial Litigation","github_url":null,"description":"A results-driven solicitor with extensive experience in commercial litigation, contractual disputes, corporate advisory, and debt recovery.","is_featured":true,"twitter_url":null,"achievements":[],"linkedin_url":"https://osbournepinner.com/team-profile-mohammed-shezaad/","display_order":19,"portfolio_url":null,"certifications":[],"is_team_member":true,"experience_years":null,"assigned_sections":[],"years_of_experience":null}

{"bio":"Sandeep Jassar is a highly driven and results-orientated Senior Solicitor with over twelve years of experience in Housing and Litigation law. He brings a wealth of qualifications and experience to the table, including a fully accredited practice management certificate, demonstrating his commitment to enhancing efficiency and relieving administrative burdens for partners. Sandeep is a conscientious team player with a genuine desire to add value to any firm he joins.

Sandeep is dedicated to providing exceptional legal service and personalised attention. He understands that legal issues can be stressful and works closely with clients to ensure they fully understand their rights and options. He is committed to achieving the best possible outcomes while maintaining the highest ethical standards.

Being a lawyer with varied and diversified experiences gained over the past 12 years enables him to meet clients at their point of need.

Sandeep has considerable experience in forming effective working relationships with people from other cultures, varied backgrounds, and walks of life.","image":"https://osbournepinner.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/11/Screenshot_2023-07-30-09-13-17-12_a23b203fd3aafc6dcb84e438dda678b6-300x298.jpg","skills":["Property Law (landlord and tenant disputes, property ownership issues)","Civil Litigation (contract breaches, debt recovery)","Housing Law (evictions, tenancy agreements)","Possession orders","Section 8 and section 21 notices","Rent arrears","Neighbour disputes","Money claims","Breach of company directors' duties","Enforcing international judgments","Company fraud","Commercial disputes"],"education":"Bachelor of Law (LLB), University of Hertfordshire; 2024 – Highfield Level 2 Award in Customer Services; 2019 – Lexcel Auditor; 2018 – Lexcel Assessor; 2012 – Lexcel Consultant; Qualified Lexcel Member; Admitted as a Solicitor, March 2011; Institute of Broking Member; Qualified Level 1 Football Coach; Member of Society for Asian Lawyers","job_title":"Senior Litigation Solicitor","pseudonym":null,"department":"Litigation & Housing","github_url":null,"description":"Sandeep is a highly driven Senior Solicitor with over twelve years of experience in Housing and Litigation law, dedicated to providing exceptional legal service.","is_featured":true,"twitter_url":null,"achievements":[],"linkedin_url":"https://osbournepinner.com/team-profile-sandeep-jassar/","display_order":21,"portfolio_url":null,"certifications":["Lexcel Auditor","Lexcel Assessor","Lexcel Consultant","Qualified Level 1 Football Coach"],"is_team_member":true,"experience_years":12,"assigned_sections":[],"years_of_experience":12}

{"bio":"Eyyubhan is a highly skilled and forward-thinking solicitor with extensive experience in high-value and complex litigation, covering both commercial and residential matters. With a breadth of experience dealing with a wide range of litigation, he has a proven track record in handling contentious probate, TOLATA claims, dilapidations, possession and writ of possession, Section 8 and Section 21 notices, rent arrears, eviction notices, boundary disputes, neighbour disputes, housing disrepair, freezing injunctions, breach of contract, asset tracing, forfeiture and relief from forfeiture, service charge, rent review, lease renewal, break notice disputes, lease disputes, and breach of covenants. His expertise also encompasses commercial and residential landlord and tenant disputes, professional negligence claims, debt recovery and enforcement, insolvency litigation, and fraud-related claims.\n\nWith a meticulous and commercially astute approach, Eyyubhan is adept at navigating complex legal frameworks while providing clear, strategic, and results-driven advice. He combines technical proficiency with a pragmatic mindset, ensuring that clients receive tailored, cost-effective solutions aligned with their objectives. His ability to think ahead, anticipate risks, and craft innovative legal strategies sets him apart in high-stakes disputes. Whether representing individuals, landlords, businesses, or property investors, Eyyubhan is committed to delivering robust, practical solutions through negotiation, alternative dispute resolution, or litigation.","image":null,"skills":["Contentious probate","TOLATA claims","Dilapidations","Possession & writ of possession","Section 8/21 notices","Rent arrears","Eviction notices","Boundary/neighbour disputes","Housing disrepair","Freezing injunctions","Breach of contract","Asset tracing","Forfeiture/relief from forfeiture","Service charge","Rent review","Lease renewal/break notice disputes","Lease/covenant breaches","Landlord/tenant disputes","Professional negligence","Debt recovery/enforcement","Insolvency litigation","Fraud claims"],"education":"","job_title":"Litigation Solicitor","pseudonym":null,"department":"Litigation","github_url":null,"description":"Eyyubhan is a highly skilled solicitor with extensive experience in high-value and complex litigation, covering both commercial and residential matters.","is_featured":true,"twitter_url":null,"achievements":[],"linkedin_url":"https://osbournepinner.com/team-profile-eyyubhan-erdem/","display_order":22,"portfolio_url":null,"certifications":[],"is_team_member":true,"experience_years":null,"assigned_sections":[],"years_of_experience":null}

{"bio":"Mostafa is a highly motivated and experienced legal professional with a strong background in international law. He is a qualified lawyer in Egypt and is currently pursuing his qualification as a solicitor in England and Wales. Mostafa holds an LLB from the University of Cairo and an LLM in international commercial and business law from ARU, Cambridge.\n\nMostafa specialises in providing legal assistance in commercial litigation cases, property practices, and alternative dispute resolution. He also provides legal assistance in a wide range of property disputes which includes landlord and tenant issues, Section 8 and Section 21 notices, rent arrears. He has previously acted for clients with various issues such as commercial rent arrears claims, asset tracing, debt recovery, alternative dispute resolution, enforcement of foreign judgements in the UK, forfeiture of commercial leases, relief against forfeiture, contractual disputes, and shareholder disputes.","image":"https://osbournepinner.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/09/Mostafa-Fares.jpg","skills":["Commercial litigation","Property disputes","Landlord & tenant","Section 8/21 notices","Commercial rent arrears","Asset tracing","Debt recovery","Enforcement of foreign judgments","Forfeiture & relief from forfeiture","Contractual & shareholder disputes"],"education":"Qualified lawyer in Egypt | Pursuing solicitor qualification in England & Wales | LLB (University of Cairo) | LLM International Commercial & Business Law (ARU Cambridge)","job_title":"Commercial Litigation Case Worker","pseudonym":null,"department":"Commercial Litigation","github_url":null,"description":"Mostafa is a highly motivated legal professional with a strong background in international law, specialising in commercial litigation and property disputes.","is_featured":true,"twitter_url":null,"achievements":[],"linkedin_url":"https://osbournepinner.com/mostafa-fares/","display_order":23,"portfolio_url":null,"certifications":[],"is_team_member":true,"experience_years":null,"assigned_sections":[],"years_of_experience":null}
